data.name: Character Options: Talents
entries: Whereas tourneys and contests of skill are grand public events and important occasions for nobility, wizarding contests are rarely met with much fanfare. Normally, they are held at lonely wizard's tower for a small audience of eclectic spellcasters, or at an arcane university to the cheers of students and faculty alike. Other times, they are played in secret, simply to prove a spellcaster's superiority over their peers.

Wizarding contests are almost always used to prove the participant's mettle, by testing their wit, skill, and creativity -the attributes most important to spellcasting. In fact, they are routinely used as exams, a final test for apprentices, to be played against their masters.

entries.name: What are Talents?
entries: Talents are extraordinary aspects of a character’s abilities, background, personality, physique, proficiencies, and features.  They are similar to, but not always as powerful as, standard Feats.   They offer a means for you to improve your current existing abilities, slightly or temporarily shift game mechanics into your favor, provide you with a new capability, or build your character’s background and personality for a richer roleplaying experience.

entries.name: What are Talents?
entries: Acquiring Talents How you wish to implement the acquisition of talents is entirely up to you as the DM.  However, below are three suggested options:

entries.name: Custom Rule.
entries.entry: You acquire a talent at 1st level, and again at 3rd level, and every 3 levels thereafter.  If you use this option, you must ensure that NPCs and monsters acquire talents too (see game balance).

entries.name: Treat as Feat.
entries.entry: When you are eligible to acquire a feat, you can take a talent instead.  When you do so, you also increase an Ability score of your choosing by 1.

entries.name: Treat as one half of a Feat.
entries.entry: When you are eligible to acquire a feat, you can take two talents instead.

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: Some talents have prerequisites. Your character must have the indicated ability score, class level, faction, feature, feat, race, skill, or other quality designated in order to select or use that talent.   You cannot use or gain the benefit of a talent if you lose the prerequisite.

entries.name: Types of Talents
entries: Some talents have prerequisites. Your character must have the indicated ability score, class level, faction, feature, feat, race, skill, or other quality designated in order to select or use that talent.   You cannot use or gain the benefit of a talent if you lose the prerequisite.  Types of Talents Some talents are general, meaning that no special rules govern them as a group.   Others are racial, which means that those talents are only available to members of that race.  .  Finally, there are class talents.  These comprise the majority of the talents, and most have specific class level requirements.

entries.name: Game Balance
entries: The introduction of talents may result in some game imbalance issues in favor of the players, especially if you use the first option (New Rule) in acquiring talents.
To address this, you can use some or all of the following options:

items: Reduce the starting total ability scores of players by 2-4 and/or set a maximum starting ability score of 14 after racial bonuses.

Assign talents to NPCs or even humanoid monsters. As a standard, monsters can have one talent for every four hit dice they have, rounded up. Class talents can also be applied to monsters who have classes or class-like features.
Increase the average level of the party by 1 for every 3 levels when calculating CR.

entries.name: Source Materials
entries: As noted in the cover and the preface, a lot of the talents use material from the Unearthed Arcana series, the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide, and Elemental Evil. You must have access to these materials.  See Appendix 1. Unearthed Arcana Links.

entries.name: The Talents
entries: The Talents Talent Descriptions Below is the format for talent descriptions: Talent Name Description of what the talent does or represents in plain language.

{@i {@b Prerequisite}: A minimum ability score, another talent or talents, member of a race or faction, or a class level that a character must have in order to acquire this talent. This entry is absent if a talent has  no prerequisite. A talent may have more than one prerequisite.}

{@b Benefit}: What the talent enables the character (“you” in the talent description) to do. If a character has the same talent more than once, its benefits do not stack unless indicated otherwise in the description.

optionalfeature.name: Agile
entries: You are quicker to react than normal
{@b BENEFIT:} You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Concussive Shot
entries: Your Thunder Monger can stun creatures.

{@b BENEFIT:} After dealing the extra thunder damage provided by your Thunder Monger to a creature, you can choose to stun it with a concussive blast.  The creature must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.  On a failed saving throw, the target takes an additional 2d8 thunder damage and is stunned until the end of your next turn.  On a successful save, the target takes half the additional damage and is not stunned.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Crazy Concoctions
entries: You can tweak the composition of your alchemical formulas, enhancing its effects.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you use any of your alchemical formulas, you can enhance one of its features.  Choose one from the following:

items: {@b Coverage}. The area of effect is doubled.
{@b Effectivity}.  The alchemical formula ignores resistance.
{@b Persistence}.  The duration of its effect is doubled.
{@b Potency}. A damage dealing or healing alchemical formula deals two additional die of damage or provides two additonal die of healing.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Deadshot
entries: You have a knack for making critical hits.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to carefully aim at a single target.  If your next attack this turn requires an attack roll and it hits the target, it is considered a critical hit.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Alchemical Formula
entries: You have knowledge of more alchemical formulas than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You learn one additonal alchemical formula of your choice.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Infused Magic
entries: You can infuse spells into nonmagical items more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} The number of infused spells you can have at a time is equal to your Intelligence modifier + 2.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Wondrous Invention
entries: You can use and create one additional magical item.

{@b BENEFIT:} You craft and complete another item of your choice.   It does not count against the number of magic of magic items you are allowed to create at certain levels from Wondrous Invention.  The item you choose must be on the list for your current artificer level or a lower level.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Gifted Inventor
entries: You can select magic items from a list higher than your current level.
{@b BENEFIT:} When choosing an item to craft from lists shown in Wondrous Invention, your current artificer level is considered as 5 levels higher.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Mechanical Sentinel
entries: Your Mechanical Sentinel is more resilient and can protect you better.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Improved Mechanical Sentinel, except it has the following additional features:

items: Any creature hit by the Sentinel gains disadvantage to any attack not made against it until the end of the Mechanical Sentinel's next turn.

If a creature moves at least 1 foot within 5 feet of it, you can use a reaction and command the Mechanical Sentinel to make one melee weapon attack against that creature. If it hits, the target’s speed is reduced to 0 until the end of this turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Mechanicial Sentinel
entries: Your Mechanical Sentinel is more powerful than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Mechanical Sentinel, except you can select a Large Beast with a challenge rating of 3 or less to design from.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Infused Servant
entries: You can infuse spells into your Mechanical Servant.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can infuse magic into your Mechanical Servant.  You can use a reaction to command the Mechanical Servant to activate the spell, as well as providing other instructions such as what to target.  It can do so even if its Intelligence is less than 6.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Mechanical Sentinel
entries: You modify your Mechanical Servant into a tough sentry and bodyguard.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can create a Mechanical Sentinel instead of a Mechanical Servant.  The Mechanical Sentinel has all the features of a Mechanical Servant, plus the following:

items: It is resistant to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons.

If you are targeted by an attack and within 5 feet of the Mechanical Sentinel, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage to the attack roll.  You command the Mechanical Sentinel to hinder the incoming attack, possibly throwing it off.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Swift Concoction
entries: You can use some of your alchemical formulas effortlessly.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to activate one of your alchemical formulas that normally require an action to use.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Armor Focus
entries: You are talented in the use of a specific armor.  You are very accustomed to it and know how to properly use it during combat.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose one armor you are proficient with.  You gain a +1 bonus to AC when wearing that type of armor while conscious and not incapacitated.  You can retake this talent.  Each time you do so, it must be applied to a different armor.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Artful Trickster
entries: You are the wise fool telling bawdy jokes, the royal jester who juggles knives, the lark-voiced minstrel strumming a lute, or a court magician casting spells of illusion.  You live to enterain but you also use your outside persona as a front and a tool to scheme, spy, distract and undermine your foes, protect those you love, or further your own goals.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Artful Trickster points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Acrobatics, Deception, Performance, Sleight of Hand, or the Disguise Kit tool, you can spend one Artful Trickster point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Artful Trickster points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.   You regain your expended Artful Trickster points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Ascetic Missionary
entries: You live a devout and disciplined life, abstaining from wordly pleasures in order to order to pursue spiritual goals, help the weak, or achieve supreme martial prowess.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Ascetic Missionary points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Insight, History, Medicine, Perception, or Religion, you can spend one Ascetic Missionary point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Ascetic Missionary points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Ascetic Missionary points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: You are an accomplished tracker and relentless pursuer of criminals and outlaws.  Sometimes you are paid to slay monsters that have been terrorizing locals.  You lay ambushes or stalk your prey.  No matter what your quarry is, you do not stop until you have its head or brought it back to justice.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Bounty Hunter points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Stealth, or any Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma check used to gain information on, detect, or track your quarry,  you can spend one Bounty Hunter point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Bounty Hunter points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Bounty Hunter points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Brillant Academic
entries: You are a young prodigy, a well-travelled professor, or an accomplished historian.  Knowledge is your tool to gain the attention of everyone around you when you explain your points.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Brilliant Academic points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Arcana, History, Investigate, Nature, or Persuasion, you can spend one Brilliant Academic point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Brilliant Academic points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Brilliant Academic points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: The follow through from your melee weapon strikes can sometimes fell another enemy within range.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, when your melee attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, any excess damage from that attack might carry over to another creature nearby. You can select another creature within reach and, and if your original attack roll can hit it, apply any remaining damage to it.  You cannot move while you perform Cleave.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Crafty Dealer
entries: You have uncanny knowledge of the prices and trends of commodities.  You can easily recognize an opportunity to earn a profit, sometimes exploiting the ignorance of others.  You are very rarely taken advantage of, and you can spot a con or trick a mile away.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Crafty Dealer points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Deception, Insight, Persuasion, or Sleight of Hand, or an Intelligence check to appraise an item, you can spend one Crafty Dealer point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Crafty Dealer points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Crafty Dealer points

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Spy
entries: You are trained in the arts of subterfuge.  You can  blend into the crowd or assume the identity of others.  You have a knack of finding ways to gain information or reach an objective without getting detected.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Cunning Spy points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Deception,  Investigation, or Stealth, or  the tool Disguise Kit, Forgery Kit, or Thieves’ Tools, you can spend one Cunning Spy point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Cunning Spy points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Cunning Spy points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Daring Explorer
entries: You are a bold, well-travelled adventurer always on the hunt for secret treasure or undiscovered areas.  You deftly avoid traps and natural hazards.  There is hardly any place you cannot reach or find a way into or any puzzle you cannot solve.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Daring Explorer points. Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Investigation, or Survival, you can spend one Daring Explorer point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Daring Explorer points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Daring Expolorer points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Dashing Scoundrel
entries: You are a rakish knave, a charming rascal, a dauntless warrior with a wit.  You face challenges with bravado and always find humor in every dire situation.  You are popular with the opposite sex and hardly anyone hates you, even if they cannot trust you.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Dashing Scoundrel points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Acrobatics, Athletics, Performance, Persuasion, or Sleight of Hand, you can spend one Dashing Scoundrel point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Dashing Scoundrel points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Dashing Scoundrel points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Devoted Bodyguard
entries: You spent most of your life watching over and protecting people you serve or love, honing your  skills in defending them from harm.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Devoted Bodyguard points.  Once per turn, you can use one of the following features: Defend Ward. Spend 2 Devoted Bodyguard points.

Choose a creature within 5 feet of you.  You can use a reaction and impose disadvantage to all attacks made against that creature until the end of the turn.   You must decide to use this feature before an attack roll is made.

items: {@b Shield Ward}.  Spend 1 Devoted Bodyguard point. When a creature within 5 feet of you takes damage from an attack, you can use a reaction to interpose yourself between the source of the attack and the creature, and take the damage yourself instead.

@b Vigilance}. Spend 1 Devoted Bodyguard point. Reroll an Initiative roll or Intelligence or Wisdom ability check made to identify or spot a possible ambush, threat, or enemy.  You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.  You regain your expended Devoted Bodyguard points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Gallant Hero
entries: You are the people’s champion, the brave knight, or the humble ronin.  You know how to carry and present yourself to people of different walks of life.  You are often the first to charge in a battle.  There is nothing more important to you than defending the weak, oppressed, and the occassional damsel in distress.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Gallant Hero points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Animal Handling, Athletics, or Persuasion, an Intelligence check to recall information about proper etiquette and customs, or an initiative roll, you can spend one Gallant Hero point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your  Gallant Hero points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.   You regain your expended Gallant Hero points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Great Cleave
entries: You can deal your full damage when you Cleave.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Cleave, but you deal your full normal damage to the additional creature you selected to attack.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Grizzled Veteran
entries: You are a retired soldier, former guard captain, or ex-mercenary.  You have survived too many wars and served under too many banners.  You may gruff and prefer not to be bothered, but you bring experience and wisdom to any group you accompany.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Grizzled Veteran points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, or Survival, you can spend one Grizzled Veteran point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Grizzled Veteran points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Grizzled Veteran points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Dodge
entries: You can attack while dodging.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you take the Dodge action, you can make one weapon attack with disadvantage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Initiative
entries: You are quicker to react than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Taunt
entries: You hurl a string of insults and slurs at a group of creatures you can see, distracting them and trying to gain their attention.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Taunt, except you can choose a number of creatures equal to your Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom modifier (your choice).

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Cleave
entries: You can Cleave more often than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} As Great Cleave, but there is no limit to the number of creatures you can attack.  As long as your melee attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can keep on choosing another creature within reach and apply your full damage to it.  You can only use this ability once per turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Multitasker
entries: You can concentrate on maintaining two spells at a time.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can maintain concentration on a spell even if you cast another spell that requires concentration.  Maintaining concentration on two spells imposes disadvantage on your Constitution checks to maintain concentration.  Casting a third spell that requires concentration ends one of the two previous spells (your pick).

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Point Blank Shot
entries: You are skilled at making well-placed shots with ranged weapons at close range.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have +1 bonus to ranged weapon damage rolls against creatures you hit within 30 feet.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Power Attack
entries: You can make exceptionally deadly melee attacks by sacrificing accuracy for strength.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, before you make a strengthbased melee weapon attack, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +5 to the attack’s damage.  This talent does not stack with the Great Weapon Mastery feat.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Rugged Outdoorsman
entries: You have dedicated your life and work in the frontier and harsh wilderness.  Your skill as a guide, a tracker, or a hunter is extraordinary.  There is hardly anyone better at what you do and thus you are often sought after.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Rugged Outdoorsman points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Animal Handling, Athletics, Nature, Perception, or Survival, you can spend one Rugged Outdoorsman point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Rugged Outdoorsman points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Rugged Outdoorsman points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shady Operator
entries: You were born in the streets, surviving the harshness of poverty and the cruelty of society.  You learned how to become resourceful, shrewd, and opportunistic.  You rose from the ranks of common thieves and thugs.  You built a network of spies and informants through extortion, deals, and favors.  You are the person to reach out to when someone need information or a job done discreetly.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Shady Operator points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth,  or Survival (urban areas only), or any Intelligence check to recall local information or identify a source of information,  you can spend one Shady Operator  point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Shady Operator  points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Shady Operator  points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shrewd Investigator
entries: From a young age you have always been highly observant.  You notice things that most others do not.  You can spot clues and significant details that others will simply find as irrelevant. You can often tell when a person is lying and can easily draw out or leverage information from others.   You can track even the most elusive of quarries.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Shrewd Investigator points.  Whenever you make an ability check that involves the skill Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, or Survival, you can spend one Shrewd Investigator point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Shrewd Investigator points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You regain your expended Shrewd Investigator points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Spell Attack Focus
entries: You are more accurate in the use of a melee or ranged spell attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose either a melee or ranged spell attack.  You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with the spell attack chosen.  You can retake this talent one more time only to select the other type of spell attack.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Street Fighter
entries: You learned to fight and survive within the dangerous seedy streets and alleyways.  You use your familiarity of it to your advantage.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Street Fighter points.  Once per turn, you can use one of the following features:

items: {@b Knock Foe}. Spend 2 Street Fighter points. On your turn, after a successful attack against a creature with an unarmed strike or improvised weapon, you can choose to stun it.  The target is allowed a Constitution saving throw to negate the effect.  The DC is equal to 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.  If the creature fails its saving throw, it is stunned until the end of your next turn.

{@b Distract Foe}.  Spend 1 Street Fighter point. While unarmed or using an improvised weapon, select a creature that is within 5 feet of you that is about to attack.  You can use a reaction and impose disadvantage to that creature's attack roll.  You must decide to use this feature before an attack roll is made.

@b Territorial Advantage}. Spend 1 Street Fighter point. Reroll any Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom ability check made in a city, town, or village you lived in for at least a year.  You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.  You regain your expended Street Fighter points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Taunt
entries: You cause a ruckus or hurl a string of insults and slurs at a creature you can see, distracting it and trying to gain its attention.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action, choose a creature you can see within 30 feet that can hear and understand you.   That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 plus your profienciency modifier plus your Charisma modifier or Intelligence modifier or Wisdom modifier (your choice).  If it fails its saving throw, it gains disadvantage to all attacks not made against you.  It can continue to make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Two-Weapon Rend
entries: You deliver a vicious double slash after hitting a creature with both your weapons at the same time.

{@b BENEFIT:} When performing two-weapon fighting and you hit a creature with both your left and right hand weapons in the same turn, you deal an additional damage equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Focus
entries: You are talented in the use of a specific weapon.  You are more accurate with it.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose one weapon you are proficient with.  You gain a +1  bonus to attack rolls made with that type of weapon.  You can retake this talent.  Each time you do so, it must be applied to a different weapon.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Witch Hunter
entries: You are trained and experienced in tracking and bringing down all manner of non-good aligned spellcasters.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Witch Hunter points.  Once per turn, you can use one of the following features:

items: {@b Slay Witch}. Spend 2 Witch Hunter points.  Reroll an attack roll made against a non-good aligned spellcaster.
{@b Resist Witch}.  Spend 2 Witch Hunter points. Reroll a saving throw made against an ability or spell cast by a non-good aligned spellcaster.

{@b Hunt Witch}. Spend 1 Witch Hunter point. Reroll an Intelligence or Wisdom ability check made to gain information on, detect, or track a non-good aligned spellcaster.  You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.

entries: You regain your expended Witch Hunter points when you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Divine Fury
entries: Your Divine Fury is more potent than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you rage, you can choose to become cloaked in an aura of divine power until the rage ends.  At the end of each of your turns for that duration, each creature within 5 feet of you takes damage equal to 1d6 + half your barbarian level. The damage is either necrotic or radiant; based on the damage type you chose when you gained Divine Fury.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Bloodlust
entries: Slaying a creature fuels your frenzy to kill, allowing you to make more attacks than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} During your turn and only once per turn while you are raging, when you slay a creature with a melee weapon attack and there is an enemy creature within range of your movement speed, you can immediately move up to your speed towards the enemy creature and make one melee weapon attack at it.  This attack does not count against the maximum number of extra attacks you can make when you take the attack action and your movement during this action does not count against your maximum move speed per turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Brute Strikes
entries: When in a frenzy while raging, you can deliver critical hits more frequently than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} When in a frenzy when raging, your melee weapon attacks score a critical on roll of 19 or 20.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Rage
entries: Your melee attacks break through armor and tough hide when you rage.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain +1 bonus to melee attack rolls while raging.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Divine Wrath
entries: When you rage, you can grow in size and inflict devastating attacks.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you rage, you can channel divine power and become an avatar of your god.  You gain the following features:

items: Your size becomes Large, unless you were larger.
Your speed becomes 50 feet, unless you were faster.
Your reach increases by 5 feet.
Your weapon attacks are considered magical and deal an additional 2d8 radiant or necrotic damage, depending on the choice you made when you gained Divine Fury.

entries: The effect lasts until your rage ends or until you use a bonus action to end it.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Rage
entries: You have the endurance to enter into a rage more often than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can enter into a rage one additional time.  This does not count against the maximum number of times you can enter into a rage shown for your barbarian leveI in the Rages column of the Barbarian table.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Rage
entries: Your melee attacks deal more damage than normal when you rage.
{@b BENEFIT:} Increase your rage damage bonus by 1.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Storm Aura
entries: The size of your Storm aura is larger than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:}  The range of your Storm Aura is increased by 10 feet, for a 20-foot radius total.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Totem Spirit
entries: Your totem spirit lasts longer than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} The Totem Spirit creature lasts until the end of your next turn.  If you also have the Twin Totem Spirit talent, both creatures last until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Unarmored Defense
entries: Your unarmored defense is better than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} Increase your unarmored defense bonus by 1. Improved Uncanny Dodge Once in a while you can avoid all damage from an attack that hits you. Prerequisite: Rogue level 12, Thief Archetype. Benefit: When an attacker you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to reduce the attack’s damage to 0. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Zealous Presence
entries: Your Zealous Presence can heal allies.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Zealous Presence, but in addition, each ally regains hit points equal to 2d8 + half your barbarian level.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Rage
entries: The massive rush of adrenaline when you successful hit a creature while you rage also heals you of your wounds.

{@b BENEFIT:} When raging,  you can choose to regain 1d4 hit points each time you hit a creature with a weapon attack.  Once your rage ends, you cannot use this feature again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Rage
entries: Your melee attacks deal extraordinary damage when you rage.
{@b BENEFIT:} This replaces and does not stack with Greater Rage.  Increase your rage damage bonus by 2.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Savagery
entries: When in a frenzy while raging, you become unnaturally bloodthirsty.  Your melee attacks deal ferocious damage.
{@b BENEFIT:} When in a frenzy while raging, you can choose to double your rage damage bonus.   Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Spiked Counter
entries: You can make a counter attack with your spiked armor.

{@b BENEFIT:} While you are raging, wearing spiked armor, and a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack at you and misses, you can use a reaction and make one melee attack at it with your armor spikes.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Summon Totem Spirit
entries: You have the ability to instantly summon your ancestral totem spirit to aid you in battle in a brief period of time.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose a creature you can see.  You can use a bonus action to summon a totem spirit that appears adjacent to you.  It has an AC of 13 and has hit points equal to twice your Barbarian level.  The totem spirit then moves up to its speed toward the target.  If it ends adjacent to the target, it can attack that enemy.  Whether it is able to attack or not, the totem spirit disappears at the end of your turn.  The damage dealt by a totem spirit is treated as magical.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

items: {@b Bear}. The spirit bear can move up to 40 feet and makes two attacks the targeted creature with its claws, each with an attack bonus of 3 plus your proficiency bonus.  Each hit deals 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.

@b Eagle}: The spirit eagle can move (fly) up to 80 feet and makes one attack with its talons at the targeted creature, with an attack bonus equal to 3 plus your proficiency bonus.  A hit deals 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw.  Failure means it becomes blinded until the end of your next turn.

@b Wolf}:  The spirit wolf can move up to 50 feet and makes one bite attack at the target, with an attack bonus equal to 3 plus your proficiency bonus.  A hit deals 10 (2d6+3) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The saving throw DC for both the Eagle and Wolf’s additional effect is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus +  your Strength modifier.

@b Elk}:  The spirit elk can move up to 50 feet and makes one ram attack at the target, with an attack bonus equal to 3 plus your proficiency bonus.  A hit deals 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage.   If the spirit elk moved at least twenty feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target takes an additional 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and  must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

@b Tiger}:  The spirit tiger can move up to 40 feet and makes one claw attack at the target, with an attack bonus equal to 3 plus your proficiency bonus.  A hit from its claw deals 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage.  If the spirit tiger moved at least twenty feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.  If the target is knocked prone, the spirit tiger can make one additional bite attack.  If it hits, it deals 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

entries: The saving throw DC for both the Elk and Tiger’s additional effect is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus +  your Strength modifier.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Summon Twin Totem Spirits
entries: You have the ability to instantly summon two of your ancestral totem spirits to aid you in battle in a brief period of time.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use your Summon Totem Spirit ability, you summon two totem spirits of the same type.  They both appear adjacent to you and you can choose to have them attack one creature or different ones.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Unrelenting Spikes
entries: You constantly twitch, jerk, and flail about during combat, hitting everyone close to you with your armor spikes.

{@b BENEFIT:} While wearing spiked armor and you aren't incapacitated, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you take 3 piercing damage.  In addition, your Spiked Retribution feature deals an additional 2 damage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Weapon of the Storm
entries: Your weapon deals additional elemental damage when you rage.

{@b BENEFIT:} While raging, your weapon deals additional elemental damage based on the environment you chose at 3rd level. Desert. Your weapon deals additional 1d6 fire damage. Sea. Your weapon deals an additional 1d6 lightning damage. Tundra. Your weapon deals an additional 1d6 cold damage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Bardic Prodigy
entries: You are naturally gifted and way ahead of your peers when it comes to magic.

{@b BENEFIT:} You learn one spell of your choice from any class. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Bard table, or a cantrip. The chosen spell counts as a bard spell for you but does not count against the number of your bard spells known.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Counter Flourish
entries: You sieze advantage of an opponent's momentary vulnerability after successfully avoiding its attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one Bardic Inspiration die to make one melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, you add the Bardic Inspiration die to the attack's damage roll.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Bardic Inspiration
entries: You have the ability to provide bardic inspiration more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use Bardic Inspiration a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier + 2. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Expertise
entries: You gain expertise in one of your skill proficiencies.
{@b BENEFIT:} Select one of your skill proficiencies that you do not have Expertise in.  Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with that skill.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Mantle of Majesty
entries: You can use Mantle of Majesty more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use Mantle of Majesty one additional time between long rests.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Shadow Lore
entries: You can use Shadow Lore more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Shadow Lore, except you can use it one additional time between long rests.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Fey Charm
entries: Your fey nature has granted you the natural ability to charm and dominate humanoids.

{@b BENEFIT:} You learn the spell Dominate Person.  You always have this spell prepared, it does not count against the number of spells you have prepared, and you can cast it once at its standard level without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can not do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Galvanizing Strike
entries: Your display of combat prowess stirs your allies to action.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after hitting and dealing damage to a creature with a weapon attack, you can use a bonus action and expend up to three uses of your Bardic Inspiration.  Choose a number of allies within 60 feet that you can see and can hear you equal to the Bardic Inspiration uses expended.  Those allies can immediately use a reaction to move up to their speed and make a single melee or ranged attack.  After you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Hilarious Jest
entries: Your Cutting Words can cause another creature to fall into fits of laughter.

{@b BENEFIT:} After successfully using Cutting Words on a creature, choose another creature within 30 feet of the Cutting Words' target that can see and hear the target.  That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall prone, becoming incapacitated and unable to stand up until the end of your next turn. A creature with an lntelligence score of 4 or less isn't affected.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Bardic Inspiration
entries: Your Bardic Inspiration is more stirring than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} Recipients of your Bardic Inspiration roll two inspiration dice instead of just one and can choose the higher result.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Blade Flourish
entries: Your Blade Flourish is more potent than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use up to two Inspiration dice when you use any of the Blade Flourish options.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Cutting Words
entries: Your Cutting Words is more insulting and distracting than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} If a creature that is a subject of your Cutting Words ability misses its attack roll, fails it ability check, or deals 0 damage, you also impose disadvantage to its first attack roll not made against you until the end of the creature’s next turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Fool's Luck
entries: Your Fool's Luck is more potent than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Fools' Luck successfully, you gain no drawback.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Mantle of Inspiration
entries: Your Mantle of Inspiration can provide more temporary hit points than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Mantle of Inspiration, except each target gains an additional number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Mantle of Whispers

{@b BENEFIT:} When you hit a creature with a weapon attack,  you can expend one cleric spell slot to deal radiant damage, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, up to to a maximum of 5d8. The damage increases by 1d8 if the creature is an undead or a fiend.  Furthermore, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw.  The saving throw DC is equal equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.  A failed save means the creature is blinded for 1 minute.  The creature is allowed a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Death and Decay
entries: You generate an aura of death that damages living creatures.

{@b BENEFIT:}  As a bonus action, you can create an aura of foul swirling shadows that is filled with necrotic energy.  Any creature that starts their turn within 10 feet of you take 2d8 necrotic damage.  The creature must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to your spell save DC or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.  The effect lasts while you concentrate, up to 1 minute.  After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you or an ally within 30 feet that you can see makes an attack, saving throw, or ability check roll but before the outcome is determined, you can use a reaction and expend a spell slot.  If you expend a first level spell slot, roll a d4 and add the result to the previous roll.  If you expend a second level spell slot, you can roll two d4s.  If you expend a third or higher level spell slot, you can roll three d4s.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

The spell slols can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your cleric level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th levei or higher. You can not use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries: Your deity has bestowed upon you the knowledge of how to strike subtly and exploit a foe’s distraction.

{@b BENEFIT:} Once every turn, you can deal an extra Id6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon. You don’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the creature is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and you don’t have disadvantage on the attack roll. The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown below:

items: 9th to 11th: +1d6
12th to 14th: +2d6
15th to 17th: +3d6
18th or higher: +4d6
This ability stacks with the Rogue’s Sneak Attack ability.

The creature must make a Strength saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your mount's Strength modifier.  On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone and your mount can immediately make one melee natural weapon attack (hoof or claw).  On a successful save, the creature isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of your space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range , the creature instead falls prone in your space.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries: You become a member of another circle and gain access to more spells granted by a Circle.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose an additional land. You now gain access from the spells listed from that land. However, you can only prepare a maximum of two circle spells per level and you must have at least one spell from each circle list per level prepared.  These do not count against the number of druid spells you can prepare.

entries: Your Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow can bestow additional benefits to you and your allies.

{@b BENEFIT:} At the end of a short or long rest within the sphere created by Hearth of Moonlight and Shadow, you can choose to provide an additional effect that benefits you and your allies.  Choose one of three effects:

items: Regain hit points equal to twice your druid level,
Regain a number of spell slots equal to one fifth of your druid level (rounded down), or
Gain a d4 Inspiration die. This is identical in function to a Bardic Inspiration die except that it must be used within a number of hours equal to your druid level.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} While transformed by Wild Shape, you can use a bonus action to expend a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level to give yourself a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls.  The bonus only applies while you are in Wild Shape form and lasts for 1 minute.   If you expend a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the bonus increases to +2.  If you expend a spell of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

In addition, you can use a reaction to give an ally you can see within 30 feet resistance to necrotic and radiant damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

The effect does not stack and it can only affect one creature (of your choosing) every spell, regardless of the spell’s number of targets.

Conjure Fey
Conjure Minor Elemental
Conjure Woodland Beings

{@b BENEFIT:} When you roll initiative, you gain a special turn that takes place before other creatures can act. On this turn you can use your action to either take the Attack, Dash, or Hide action. If you would normally be surprised at the start of an encounter, you are not surprised but you do not gain this extra turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

In addition, you end one disease or one condition afflicting it.  The condition must be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.
Once you use either feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

After you roll for an ability check that involves the skill Animal Handling, Nature, Medicine, Perception (wilderness areas only), or Survival (wilderness areas only) but before the outcome is determined, you can roll a d10 and add it to the result. In both cases, you must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.  Once you use either feature, you cannot use any of them again until you complete a short or long rest.

The DC is equal to 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).  The condition imposed on the creature is based on the type of damage dealt: Bludgeoning.  The creature is stunned until the end of your next turn. Piercing.  The creature is blinded until the end of your next turn.

{@b Slashing}. The creature is slowed until the end of your next turn.  It is also bleeding and will take an additional weapon damage at the start of your next turn. When you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you take a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Weapons Specialization
entries: You specialize and hone your skills in the use of one type of weapon.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose a weapon you have the talent Weapon Focus on.  Your weapon damage rolls with the chosen weapon deal an additional 1d4 damage.  You can retake this talent.  Each time you do so, it must be a different weapon that you have the talent Weapon Focus on.

optionalfeature.name: Conservator
entries: You have the ability to identify magic items.

{@b BENEFIT:} You learn the Identify spell.  You always have this spell prepared and it does not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.   You only spend half the amount of material components needed (50gp) when casting this spell.

entries: You can draw on your magical heritage to escape danger.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to become invisible until the end of your next turn.   After you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gnome Furtiveness
entries: You have the uncanny ability to to resist and possibly avoid breath weapon attacks.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you are subjected to a breath weapon effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you can use a reaction and instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gnomish Racial Foe Expertise
entries: You know how to fight your racial enemies more effectively than others.
{@b BENEFIT:} Your weapon damage rolls deal an additional 1d4 damage against kobolds, fomorians, and goblinoids.

optionalfeature.name: Elven Senses

optionalfeature.name: Natural Diplomat
entries: You are a wordly individual.  You are skilled in the arts of diplomacy, negotiation, and court politics.

{@b BENEFIT:} You learn one extra language of your choice.  After you roll for an ability check that involves the skill History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion but before the outcome is determined, you can roll a d10 and add it to the result.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Furious Assault
entries: Wrath burns within you, fueling  your attacks with ferocity.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose a creature that has hit or dealt damage to you or an ally.  Once per turn, when you hit that creature with a melee attack, you can deal an additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus + strength modifier.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Orcish Brute Ancestry
entries: Your Orcish heritage gives you extraordinary might and fortitude.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on all Strength and Constitution ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Orcish Resilience
entries: Your Orcish lineage makes you difficult to bring down.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level plus twice your Constitution modifier.  The temporary hit points last for 1 minute.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Orcish Rush
entries: Your Orcish heritage gives you extraordinary might and fortitude.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward an enemy that you can see or hear.  If you end your movement adjacent to that enemy, you can also make one melee weapon attack at it.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Orcish Weapon Familiarity
entries: You are proficient with the use of orcish traditional weapons.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain proficiency with the club, spear, greatclub, greataxe, and maul.

optionalfeature.name: Born Sneaky
entries: Your heritage allows you to be more catlike in movement, crafty, and deceptive than most.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can reroll an ability check that involves the skill Deception, Sleight of Hands, or Stealth. You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest

optionalfeature.name: Fortunate
entries: You have a knack for avoiding or resisting things that can be unpleasant to you.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can reroll a saving throw.  You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Nimble Reaction
entries: You have a knack for avoiding things that can be unpleasant to you.
{@b BENEFIT:} You impose disadvantage on attacks made by enemies who used a bonus action or reaction to make weapon attacks against you.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Second Chance
entries: Luck and small size combine to work in your favor as you dodge your enemy’s attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} When an enemy hits you but before rolling damage, you can use a reaction to have the enemy reroll the attack again.  The enemy uses the second roll, even if it is lower.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Strongheart
entries: You come from a bloodline known to be more hardy and courageous than most.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on death saving throws and saving throws against energy drain attacks and being frightened.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Harper Favored Foes
entries: You have trained against and carefully studied two specific evil organizations.  You are very knowledgeable of their groups and can identify their members.  You are often tapped to infiltrate their ranks and spy on them.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose two evil organizations (Cult of the Dragon, Red Wizards, Zhentarim, etc.).  You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma ability checks made against them, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.   You can retake this talent as many times you want.  Each time you take it, it must be two different evil organizations.

optionalfeature.name: Harper Knowledge
entries: The life of a Harper has provided you with the opportunity to pick up odds and ends of knowledge.

{@b BENEFIT:} You gain proficiency in one of the following tools: the Disguise kit, Forgery kit, Gaming Set, an Instrument, or Thieves’ Tools.  After you roll for any Intelligence ability check but before the outcome is determined, you can roll a d10 and add the result.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tymora's Smile
entries: You call upon Lady Luck to bestow upon you an amount of good fortune for a short period of time.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to gain advantage on all saving throws for 1 minute.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Human Aptitude
entries: Due to a relative short life span, you have become more resourceful and competitive than other races.  You often succeed when others do not.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you make an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check but before the outcome is determined, you can roll a d10 and add the result to the previous roll.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Human Ingenuity
entries: Driven by ambition, you learn faster and become more skilled than others.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain proficiency in one skill, tool, or weapon.  You can retake this talent.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Human Resolve
entries: You can push yourself to the limit for a short period of time when needed.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action or a reaction  to temporarily increase your proficiency bonus by 1 for 1 minute.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Best Defense is a Strong Offense
entries: You are trained to strike first at a creature that is attacking you, potentially making the creature miss.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you are about to be attacked by a creature with a melee weapon attack but before the outcome is determined, you can use a reaction to make a single melee weapon attack against that creature. If your attack hits, you impose disadvantage to the creature’s attack. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Glory and Honor
entries: You call your allies into action, inspiring them to fight and perform better for the glory and honor of your alliance.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose a number of creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see equal to half your class level.  You can use a bonus action to have you and those creatures you selected gain an advantage on their next attack roll or ability check.  The benefit lasts until the end of your next turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: United Against the Dark
entries: You inspire your allies, uniting them to fight back against the dark forces that threaten you.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose a number of creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see equal to half your class level.  You can use a reaction to have you and those creatures you chose gain advantage on their next saving throw.  The benefit lasts until the start of your next turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Bloodline of Fire
entries: You are descended from the Efreet who ruled Calimshan for two millenia.  The blood of these fire outsiders runs thick in your veins.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on saving throws against fire

optionalfeature.name: Cypher

{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks made when deciphering and remembering code, puzzles, archaic signs, and ancient texts, as well as recognizing the gist of a sentence that uses a language you do not understand.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose from the following damage types (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder).  Increase the DC of your abilities, features, or spells with this type of damage by 1.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

Additionally, if you take an amount of damage from one source that is enough to kill you, you can use a reaction and reduce the damage to an amount that leaves you with 1 hit point. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Attunement
entries: You can attune with more magical items than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} Increase the number of items you can attune to by 1. You can retake this talent one more time only, but you must be of level 18 or higher when you do so.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Fortified

optionalfeature.name: Light Armor Master
entries: You can move and dodge attacks fluidly even while wearing your armor.

{@b BENEFIT:} While wearing light armor and you are targeted by a weapon attack, you can use a reaction and impose disadvantage on the attack roll.  You must decide to use this feature before the attack is rolled.  Once you have used this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries: You improve upon your basic knowledge of the arcane arts.

{@b BENEFIT:} Choose one 1st-level spell from the spellcaster list you have chosen as Magic Initiate. You learn that spell and can cast it at its lowest leveI.   Once you cast it, you must finish a long rest before you can cast it again.
