optionalfeature.name: Runner
entries: You can run faster than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} Your speed is increased by 10 feet when you use the Dash action. Superior Athlete You are a very accomplished athlete. Prerequisite: Athlete feat. Benefit: Whenever you make a Dexterity or Strength ability check or saving throw, you can roll a d8 and add it to the result. You can choose to do this after you roll the initial die, but before the outcome is determined.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

entries: You are talented in the use of a tool you are proficient with.
{@b BENEFIT:} Choose one tool you are proficient with.  You have a +2 bonus to ability checks made with it.  You can retake this talent.  Each time you do so, it must be applied to a different tool.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Abundant Step

optionalfeature.name: Confounding Strikes
entries: You can confuse and distract creatures hit by your flurry of blows.
{@b BENEFIT:} You impose disadvantage to the next attack roll of a creature you hit with your Flurry of Blows.  You can only impose this disadvantage to a single creature per turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Drunken Mongoose
entries: You can dodge and redirect a creature’s attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} When a creature hits you with a melee weapon attack but before the outcome is determined, you can use a reaction and spend a number of Ki points (minimum of 1) and add it to your AC. If the creature’s attack would now count as a miss, you can choose to redirect that attack to another creature that is within its range. Use the original attack roll to determine if the attack hits.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Combo

{@b BENEFIT:} After you use an action to cast an elemental discipline, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Elemental Discipline
entries: You have knowledge of more elemental disciplines than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You learn one new elemental discipline.   You can retake this talent one additional time only.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Ki
entries: You have more Ki points than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} Increase your total Ki points by 2.  You can retake this talent one additional time only.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Tipsy Sway
entries: You can use Tipsy Sway more often than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you are targeted by a weapon attack, you can spend 2 ki points as a reaction and impose disadvantage on the attack roll.  You must decide to use this feature before the attack is rolled.  If you are still hit, you take only half the normal damage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Flaming Fists

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action, you can spend 3 ki points and channel your inner light into your strikes.  Your unarmed attacks and radiant sun bolts deal an additional 1d6 fire damage.  This effect lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Ki-Empowered Strikes

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Healing Hands
entries: Your healing hands restore more hit points than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you restore hit points to a creature using your Healing Hands feature, the creature also regains an additional number of hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.  This additional hit points does not count against the pool of your magical healing.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: You can temporarily make your Ki-Empowered Strikes more effective.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can spend 1 Ki point to bestow a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed attacks.  The bonus lasts until the end of your turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Radiant Sun Bolt
entries: Your radiant sun bolts have a longer range than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} The range of your radiant sun bolt is increased to 50 feet.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Touch of Death
entries: Your Touch of Death is more potent than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Touch of Death and you reduce a creature to a number of hit points equal to or less than your cleric level, you deal an additional necrotic damage equal to your cleric level.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Shadow Step
entries: You can use Shadow Step even if it is not your turn.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to perform Shadow Step.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mortal Strike
entries: You harness your Ki to enable you to make deadly strikes with your Kensai weapon.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can spend 3 ki points to enable your Kensai weapon attacks to score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.  If you have advantage to the target, you score a critical hit on a roll of 18 to 20.  The effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Safe Haven
entries: You can attempt to protect a creature from impending harm.

{@b BENEFIT:} When a creature other than yourself is targeted with an attack or by a harmful spell, you can spend 2 ki points as a reaction to cast the Sanctuary spell on that creature.  The creature attacking or casting the harmful spell gains disadvantage to their Wisdom saving throw.  Once you cast the spell in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after using Shadow Step, the first melee attack you make has advantage.  If you hit, you deal extra damage equal to your  Wisdom modifier.  Additionally, any hit you score against a creature that is surprised is a critical hit.

entries: You can stun a creature with your Soul Knife.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, when you hit a creature while using Soul Knife, you can attempt to stun it.  The creature is allowed an Intelligence saving throw equal to 8 + your proficency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.  On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Faith Against Evil

otherSummary.entry: Order of the Gauntlet faction membership.

entries: Your faith in your deity is stronger than normal, it enables you to resist most evil spells and effects.

{@b BENEFIT:} After you roll for a saving throw against an evil creature’s spell or ability, you can roll a d12 and add the result to the roll.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Punish the Evil

otherSummary.entry: Order of the Gauntlet faction membership.

entries: Driven by a sense of justice, you can impose your will on an evil creature, reducing its capabilities to fight and perform.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, as a bonus action, choose an evil-aligned creature you can see within 60 feet that you have dealt damage to or has failed a saving throw against your spell or class feature within the previous turn.  The creature is allowed a saving throw to negate the effect.  The DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your main ability modifier.  If the creature fails its saving throw, you impose disadvantage to all of its attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of your next turn.  If you have successfully used this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Strength and Honor

otherSummary.entry: Order of the Gauntlet faction membership.

entries: Strength and Bravery You have extraordinary strength of will when battling evil.

{@b BENEFIT:} After you roll an attack roll, a Strength ability check, or a saving throw against being frightened but before the outcome is determined, you can roll an additional d8 and add it to the result.   Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest. Strongheart You come from a bloodline known to be more hardy and courageous than most. Prerequisite: Halfling, Stout. Benefit: You have advantage on death saving throws and saving throws against energy drain attacks and being frightened.

The effect lasts while you concentrate, up to 1 minute.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

The chosen spell counts as a Paladin spell for you but does not count against the number of Paladin spells you know.  You can retake this talent one additional time only.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Servant
entries: You can summon and command a fiend.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use an action to summon a fiend from the lower planes.  The fiend must have a CR equal to or less than one-fourth your Paladin level, rounded down.  The fiend is bound to you for the next 24 hours.  A bound creature must follow your instructions to the best of its ability. You might command the creature to accompany you on an adventure, to guard a location, or to deliver a message. The creature obeys the letter of your instructions. If the creature carries out your instructions completely before the spell ends, it travels to you to report this  act if you are on the same plane of existence. If you  are on a different plane of existence, it returns to  the place where you bound it and remains there until the spell ends.  You can only have one fiendish servant at a time.  If you summon another fiendish servant while you currently have one already bound, the latter immediately returns to its plane of existence.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

@b Treacherous Strike}. When you force an attacker to reroll an attack against a creature of your choice that is also within 5 feet of the attacker, you can add your Charisma modifier to the attacker's roll.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Fey Step
entries: You can use Fey Step more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use Fey Step one additional time between rests.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Feet on the Ground
entries: You are difficult to move by force while your feet are planted on the ground.
{@b BENEFIT:} While standing on solid stone, soil, or metal, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being knocked down, pushed, pulled, or forced away from the ground.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Fey Strike
entries: You can catch an enemy unawares after teleporting beside them.
{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after you use Fey Step to teleport within 5 feet of an enemy, you gain advantage on your first weapon attack roll made against that enemy.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Fey Tactics
entries: You can also teleport an ally when you use Fey Step.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Fey Step, you can also choose to teleport one ally within 30 feet that you can see to a distance equal or less than your Fey Step distance.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Flyby Attack
entries: You can avoid attacks of opportunity while flying near enemies' reach.
{@b BENEFIT:} While flying, you can use a bonus action to disengage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Giant's Gait
entries: You can cover longer distances than normal when enlarged.
{@b BENEFIT:} When enlarged, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Githyanki Willpower
entries: You have greater willpower than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on saving throws against charm and fear.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Goring Charge
entries: You deal extra damage when you charge with your horns.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Goring Rush and move at least 10 feet straight toward a target and hit it with your horns, you can choose to deal an additional 2d8 piercing damage.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Abyssal Arcana
entries: You have a chance of randomly acquiring better spells from Abyssal Arcana.

{@b BENEFIT:} Each time you roll a new spell for each level, you may roll twice and select one of the results.  You cannot choose the same cantrip or spell that you gained from the previous long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Goring Rush
entries: You can knock a creature prone with your Goring Rush.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Goring Rush and hit a creature with your horns, you can attempt to knock it prone.  The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.  The DC is equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Hammering Horns
entries: Your hammering horns deal damage while you use them to shove.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you successfully shove a creature with Hammering Horns, you also deal damage to it equal to your your Strength modifier.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Stone Grip
entries: You can wield up to two two-handed weapons at the same time.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can wield a two-handed melee weapon in each hand at the same time.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Shift
entries: You can Shift even if it is not your turn.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to activate Shifting.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Instrictive Fey Step
entries: You can use Fey Step even if it is not your turn.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to activate Fey Step.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Iron Mind
entries: You instantly create a telekinetic shield around you.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction and gain resistance to all damage until the end of the turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: Your composite plating is heavily reinforced and makes you a near-unstoppable force.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on Strength checks made when you shove or get shoved.  Additionally, your unarmed strikes are considered adamantine when dealing damage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Mountain's Tenacity
entries: You have tenacious strength of will.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can choose to gain advantage on any Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw.  You must decide before making the roll.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Attack
entries: You can abandon all defensive concerns and attack with full savagery.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can choose to gain advantage to all your melee weapon attack rolls using Strength this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Reinforeced Plating
entries: Your composite plating is modified with reinforced steel.
{@b BENEFIT:} Bludgeoning. piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical or nonadamantine weapons is reduced by 2.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shifter Defense
entries: You can be resistant to most physical attacks while in shifter form.

{@b BENEFIT:} While Shifting and you are hit with a nonmagical weapon or attack, you can use a reaction and gain resistance from that attack's damage.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shifter Healing Factor
entries: Your wounds heal when you Shift.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you Shift, you regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your class level + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shifter Instincts
entries: Your keen animal-like senses make you difficult to catch by surprise.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have 3 Shifter Instincts points.  Whenever you make an Initiative roll or a Wisdom (Perception) check,  you can spend one Shifter Instincts point to roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to spend one of your Shifter Instincts points after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.   You regain your expended Shifter Instincts points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Shifting Fortunes
entries: You can telekinetically move yourself a short distance even if it is not your turn.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action or a reaction to fly 15 feet.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Stone Grip
entries: You can wield with one hand weapons that normally require two hands to properly use.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can wield a two-handed melee weapon in one hand.  However, you cannot wield a two-handed melee weapon in each hand at the same time.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Summon Swarm
entries: You can summon swarms of tiny beasts to fight for you.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, you can use an action to summon swarms of bats, insects, rats, or ravens.  You can summon a number of swarms equal to or less than one-fourth your level, rounded up.  The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Sunlight Adaptation
entries: You have grown accustomed to daylight after decades of living on the surface world.
{@b BENEFIT:} You do not gain disadvantage from attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks imposed by Sunlight Sensitivity.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Swift Shapechange
entries: You can shapechange quicker than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to activate your Shapechange ability.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Telekinetic Leap
entries: You can telekinetically move yourself or an ally.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, you can use a bonus action and make yourself or a willing ally fly up to 30 feet. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Warforged Adaptation
entries: You can adapt and switch skill sets if needed.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you finish a long rest, you can temporarily replace one of your skill or tool proficiencies with a new one of your choice.   This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Warforged Resilience
entries: You are hardier than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.  Additionally, you have advantage on death saving throws.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Warforged Resistance
entries: Your composite plating is built to resist the most common elemental attacks.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have resistance to fire and cold.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Water's Calm
entries: You enter into a meditative rest and gain restorative benefits.
{@b BENEFIT:} During a short rest, you can enter into a trance.  After the short rest, you can choose from two options:

items: {@b Heal Self}. Regain hit points equal to twice your level plus your Constitution modifier, or
{@b Recover Spell}. Regain a number of expended spell slots that must have a total number of levels equal to or less than one-fourth your level, rounded up.

entries: Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Water's Chill
entries: You have a natural talent to create and manipulate ice from the water around you.

{@b BENEFIT:}  You can cast the spells Ice Knife and Armor of Agathys.  You cast each of these spells once at a level equal to one-fourth your class level rounded up, and you regain the ability to cast them this way after you finish a long rest.   Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Wind's Guardian
entries: An eternal wind surrounds and protects you.

{@b BENEFIT:}  You can use your reaction to deflect a missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d6 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Beast Combo Strike
entries: You exploit a creature’s momentary vulnerability when both you and your beast companion hit it at the same time.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, if both you and your beast companion attacked and hit the same creature in the same turn, you can use a bonus action to have both you and your beast companion make one weapon attack each at the same creature. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Beast Intercept
entries: You can command your beast companion to cut off a moving creature.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a reaction to command your beast companion to move up to its speed to a square adjacent to an enemy.  If your beast companion ends its movement adjacent to that enemy, it can make one melee attack.  If the attack hits, the speed of the enemy becomes 0 until the end of its turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Deep Spelunker
entries: Your familiarity with the environs of the Underdark allows you to move through it easily, even in the most difficult conditions.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks when in natural subterranean surroundings.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Lore
entries: You gain access to one spell from the Druid spell list.

{@b BENEFIT:} You learn one spell of your choice from the Druid’s spell list. The spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Ranger table. The chosen spell counts as a Ranger spell for you but don’t count against the number of Ranger spells you know.  You can retake this talent one additional time only.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Defensive Tactics
entries: You have extra knowledge of Defensive Tactics than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain one other feature from the Defensive Tactics list.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Favored Enemy
entries: You have more favored enemies than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain one additional favored enemy.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Favored Terrain
entries: You have more favored terrain than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain one additional favored terrain.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Hunter's Prey
entries: You have knowledge of more Hunter’s Prey combat manuevers than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain one other feature from the Hunter’s Prey list.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Favored Enemy
entries: You know how to exploit your favored enemies’ vulnerabilities in combat.
{@b BENEFIT:} Your weapon attacks against your favored enemies score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Guardian Soul
entries: You are more mobile and tougher when in guardian form.

{@b BENEFIT:} As Guardian Soul, except when in guardian form your speed is increased to 30 feet.  In addition, the number of temporary hit points you gain at the start of each of your turns is equal to your ranger level.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Planar Warrior
entries: You can deal the additional force damage gained from Planar Warrior damage each time you hit the creature.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain advantage on your attacks against a creature you targeted with your Planar Warrior feature this turn.  This feature lasts until you hit the creature with an attack.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Greater Ranger's Companion
entries: You can gain a more dangerous beast companion than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} As Ranger’s Companion, but you can choose a beast of Large size or smaller as a companion.  It must have a challenge rating of 2 or lower.  If it has two or more attacks, it does not benefit from Bestial Fury.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Distance Strike
entries: You can teleport farther than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Distant Strike, except you can teleport up to 20 feet before each attack.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Favored Enemy
entries: You know how to fight your favored enemies more effectively in combat.
{@b BENEFIT:} Your weapon damage rolls deal an additional 1d4 damage against your favored enemies.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Guardian Aura
entries: Your aura is more potent than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Guardian Aura, except as follows: • the range of  your aura is increased to 40 feet • the aura can affect creatures who have half or more  of its hit points

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Guardian Soul
entries: Your mobility increases and your bark-like skin becomes harder when in guardian form.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Guardian Soul, except when in guardian form your speed is increased to 15 feet.  In addition, the damage you take from bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing attacks is reduced by 2.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Multiattack
entries: Once in a while you can unleash Volley or Whirlwind Attack quicker than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, you can use a bonus action to perform a Volley or Whirlwind Attack.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.  You can still use an action to perform Volley or Whirlwind Attack as normal.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Planar Warrior
entries: You deal additional damage with your Planar Warrior feature.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Planar Warrior, except you deal an additional 1d8 force damage the next time you hit the targeted creature.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Ranger's Companion
entries: You can gain a better beast companion than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} As Ranger’s Companion, but it can have a challenge rating of 1 or lower and it can only make one attack every turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Slayer's Eye
entries: You can deal extra damage to a creature you targeted with Slayer's Prey more often than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You deal the additional damage each time you hit the target of your Slayer's Prey feature with a weapon attack instead of just the first time during a turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Supernatural Defense
entries: You can anticipate and read the attacks  of the target of your Slayer's Eye, helping you avoid them.
{@b BENEFIT:} You impose disadvantage to your Slayer's Prey's target's first attack roll made against you each turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Tremor Sense
entries: Your connection with the Underdark increases, providing you with enhanced senses.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain Tremorsense out to 30 feet.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Combat Mobility
entries: When you move before an attack, you deal more damage.
{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you move at least 20 feet, you deal an additional 1d6 weapon damage on your next weapon attack this turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Maneuver
entries: You can catch your opponent by surprise with an acrobatic stunt.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use your Cunning Action to move through a creature's space by using an acrobatic stunt - a tumble, a flip, a pirouette, a slide, or a barrel roll.  When you do so, you can make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check contested by the creature’s Wisdom (Insight) check.  If your check succeeds, you can use Sneak Attack against that creature even if you do not have advantage against it or if no enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it.  You can use Sneak Attack in this way even if you have disadvantage against the target.  However, you are still only allowed one Sneak Attack per turn.  If your check fails, you are unable to move into the creature's space, fall prone and stopping within 5 feet of it, fall prone.  Your speed also becomes 0 and you gain disadvantage to your attacks until the end of the turn.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

{@b BENEFIT:} You treat the spear as a finesse weapon. Additionally, on your turn, you can choose to gouge a creature’s eyes after a successful sneak attack  with a piercing weapon.  The creature is allowed a saving throw to negate the effect.  The DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.  If the creature fails its saving throw, it is blinded for 1 minute.  The creature is allowed a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

Additionally, on your turn, after a successful sneak attack hit with a slashing weapon,  you can forgo 1d6 sneak attack damage and attempt to slow the creature struck.  The creature is allowed a saving throw to negate the effect.  The DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.  If the creature fails its saving throw, it is slowed for 1 minute.  The creature is allowed a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

On your turn, after a successful sneak attack with a bludgeoning weapon against a creature, you can forgo 1d6 sneak attack damage and choose to sap it.  The creature is allowed a saving throw to negate the effect.  The DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier.  If the creature fails its saving throw, it is stunned for 1 minute.  The creature is allowed a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns. {@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.  You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks when jumping if you use a 10-foot pole.  Additionally, you can use the 10-foot pole as a weapon (treat as quarterstaff, but it is a finesse weapon to you and has a reach of 10 feet).

items: {@b Cold Damage}. The target is slowed for 1 minute.  The target is allowed a Constitution saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
{@b ightning Damage}. The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.
{@b Forced Movement}. The target is knocked prone.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

You attack with each wing as if they are melee spell attacks that have a range of 10 feet. Each wing attack deals magical damage equal to 1d8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

items: You have a flying speed of 80 feet.

You gain the physical stats, hit points, Hit Dice, and qualities of a Fire Elemental except you take the shape and form of a giant fiery eagle and you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma scores, skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of a Fire Elemental.  For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell.

optionalfeature.name: Manipulate Earth
entries: You can control and manipulate the earth, stone, and metal around you, using it as a weapon or a means to move.
{@b BENEFIT:} While using Stone's Durability, you can enter into a state where you can mentally manipulate the earth around you.  Each turn, you can perform the following abilities:

items: {@b Launch Earth}. As an action, you remove and raise a 5-foot square section of the earth from the ground and launch it to a target within 60 feet of you.  Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw.  The save DC is equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC.  A target creature takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Raise or Lower Earth}. As a bonus action, you can raise or lower the 5-foot square section of a ground within 30 feet.  You can raise or lower the earth to a height or depth of up to 20 feet, creating a pillar of earth or a pit.  You can continue to raise the pillar or lower the pit's depth, up to 20 feet per bonus action, up to a total of 60 feet.

{@b Form Bridge}. As a bonus action, you can create a bridge made from earth 20 feet long and 5 feet wide.  You can continue to lengthen the bridge, up to 20 feet per bonus action, up to a total of 60 feet.  However, the origin point of the bridge must stay connected to the earth at all times.  Otherwise, the bridge collapses.

entries: This feature lasts while you maintain concentration, up to 1 minute.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} After rolling and determining the number on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can choose a result that is lower or higher than the number.  The number must be within range of your Charisma modifier if it is added or subtracted from the original number.  For example, if you have a Charisma of 20 and you rolled a 66 on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can choose any number from 61 to 71 as your result. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action you can spend up to 6 Sorcery points and summon a Shadow for every 2 Sorcery points you spent.

The Shadows are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The Shadows last while you concentrate, up to an hour.

You gain advantage on your attacks against that creature until the end of your turn. If you hit with an attack, you deal an additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier. If you used this feature when you were targeted by an attack  or was hit by an attack but before the outcome was determined, that attack automatically misses or fails.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Raven Strike
entries: You can send your Sentinel Raven to strike to unerringly strike at a target.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action during your turn, choose a creature within 100 feet of you that you can see (even through your raven's eyes).  Your raven immediately flies and dives toward the target creature.  Make a melee spell atack against that creature.  On a successful hit, the raven deals 1d8 piercing damage + your Charisma modifier and the creature gains disadvantage to its next attack until the end of its next turn.  The raven's attack is considered a magical weapon attack.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Tentacles of the Old One
entries: You can create large grotesque tentacles that grasp and constrict victims.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action, you summon several large,  alien-like spiny tentacles that fill a 30 foot square on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained by the tentacles until the effect ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already restrained by the tentacles takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage. A creature restrained by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your Warlock spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
The effect lasts while you concentrate, up to 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} Increase the DC of the spells from the school of your chosen Arcane Tradition by 1.

entries: You are a secret operative under the employ of the Black Network.  Your primary objective is to infiltrate and gather information in urban areas and territories normally hostile to the Zhentarim.

{@b BENEFIT:} You gain proficiency with the Disguise Kit, Forgery Kit, Gaming Set, or Thieves’ Tools (your choice).  After you roll an ability check that involves the skill Deception, Investigation (urban areas only), Perception (urban areas only), Sleight of Hand, or Survival (urban areas only) but before the outcome is determined, you can roll an additional d10 and add it to the result.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

After you roll an ability check that involves the skill Athletics, Intimidation, Survival (urban areas only), Stealth, or a Dexterity (Thieves’ Tools) check, but before the outcome is determined, you can roll an additional d10 and add it to the result.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries: You are a practicioner of the dark arts, concocter of strange potions and medicine, and a follower  of the eldritch gods, fiends, or old gods.  People seek you out when they require help or information about love, sickness, or death.
{@b BENEFIT:} You have two features:

items: {@b Reroll Ability}. You can reroll an ability check that involves the skill Arcana, History, Medicine, Nature, or Religion, or any ability check that uses the Herbalism Kit.   You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower.

{@b Impose Saving Throw Disadvantage}. Choose a creature.  When you cast an enchantment or necromancy spell at that creature, you can use a bonus action and impose disadvantage to the creature’s saving throw roll. Once you use either feature, you cannot use any of them again until you complete a long rest.

entries: You can leap great distances and land with an explosive impact that deals damage to creatures nearby.

{@b BENEFIT:} While raging, when you use the attack option, you can use one of your attacks  to leap into the air and land in a square 40 feet away. Upon landing, you create an elemental explosion centered on you and within your Storm aura’s effect.  The type of damage is based on the environment you chose at 3rd level.  Each creature within your aura other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier.

items: {@b Desert}. Enemies within your aura take 18 [4d8] fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
{@b Sea}. Enemies within your aura take 18 [4d8] lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

{@b Tundra}. Enemies within your aura take 18 [4d8] cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries: Your totem spirit lasts longer than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, you can use a bonus action and summon an Ancestral Guardian that will appear in a space of your choice that is within 30 feet of you.  The Ancestral Guardian appears as an identical spirit version of yourself.  It has an AC of 13, hit points equal to your total maximum,  and a base movement speed of 40 feet. However, it cannot perform any actions except move. As long as you or an ally is within 30 feet of the Ancestral Guardian, they gain the following benefits:

items: any damage they take is transfered to the Ancestral Guardian;
all attack rolls made against them have disadvantage

entries: The Ancestral Guardian lasts for 1 minute or until its hit points reaches 0, at which point it dissipates.  You can use a bonus action to direct the Ancestral Guardian to move.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you take a long rest.

entries: Your totem spirit lasts longer than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after hitting and dealing damage to a creature with a weapon attack, you can use a bonus action and roll a Bardic Inspiration die.  Until the start of your next turn, the creature takes additional weapon damage equal to the number you rolled on the Bardic Inspiration die from every weapon attack made against it, up to a maximum number of attacks equal to your Charisma modifier. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action or a reaction and expend up to three Bardic Inspiration dice.   Choose a number of creatures equal to the Bardic Inspiration uses expended.  You impose disadvantage to their next saving throw this turn. After you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.
