(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Ambuscade
entries: You are often on your guard and can act before anybody else at the start of combat.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you roll initiative, you can use a special turn that takes place before other creatures can act.  On this turn you can use your action to either take the Attack, Dash,  or Hide action.   You can also use your action to Cast a Spell or Use an Item action but the spell's casting time or item activation should take no more than 1 action.   If you would normally be surprised at the start of an encounter, you are not surprised but you do not gain this extra turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Battle Magic
entries: You can strike with your melee weapon after casting a cantrip or spell.

{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you cast a cantrip or spell, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack.   Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Extra Combat Maneuver
entries: You have knowledge of more combat maneuvers than normal.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain one new combat superiority maneuver of your choosing.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Archery
entries: You can aim better with your ranged attacks.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you make a ranged attack roll, you can choose to give yourself advantage on that roll.  You must decide to use this feature before rolling. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Defensive Duelist
entries: You can make a counter attack after deflecting an attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} If a creature's melee attack missed you as a result of using the Defensive Duelist feat, you can immediately make a melee weapon attack at the same creature. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Protection
entries: Your attacks keep the attention of your target on you.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after hitting a creature with a melee attack, you can choose to impose disadvantage to all of its attack rolls not made against you until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature three times.  You regain expended uses after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Sniper
entries: You can deliver a deadly ranged attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, if there would normally be no disadvantage imposed on your ranged attack, you can use a bonus action to gain advantage on your next ranged attack roll.  You must decide to use this feature before rolling. If you roll number that is at least 5 or more than what is needed to hit, you score a critical hit. Once you have successfully used this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Spell Marksman
entries: You seldom miss or deal glancing shots with your ranged attacks.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can reroll a ranged spell attack. You must use the result of the second roll, even if it is lower. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Sundering Blow
entries: You can deliver a powerful, armor crunching blow that momentarily makes the target vulnerable.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after successfully dealing damage to a creature with your weapon, you can choose to give advantage to the next attack roll made against the same creature before the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Wrestler
entries: Your grappling skills are more advanced than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:}  Whenever you successfully grapple a creature, you can use a bonus action to automatically pin that creature. Additionally, while you are restrained, your attacks against the pinned creature do not suffer disadvantage.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Dwarven Racial Foe Expertise
entries: You were raised and trained to fight your racial enemies more effectively than others.
{@b BENEFIT:} Your weapon damage rolls deal an additional 1d4 damage against orcs, goblinoids, and giants.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Canny
entries: Your intellectual skills are impeccable.

{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you make an Intelligence ability check, you can roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to do this after you roll the initial die, but before the outcome is determined. You can use this feature three times.  You regain all expended uses after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Dungeoneer
entries: You can guide your companions safely through trap-filled dungeons.

{@b BENEFIT:} You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect the presence of traps and secret fixtures (compartments, switches, illusory walls, etc.) while indoors or underground.  In addition, you can use a reaction to give allies within 30 feet of you that can hear and see you advantage to saving throws made to avoid or resist traps and resistance to damage dealt by traps until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature three times.  You regain all  expended uses after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Enthralling
entries: You have a naturally charming and magnetic personality.

{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you make a Charisma ability check, you can roll a d12 and add it to the result. You can choose to do this after you roll the initial die, but before the outcome is determined.   You can use this feature three times.  You regain all  expended uses after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Hardy
entries: You know how to use your armor to partially deflect weapon attacks.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you take damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice your class level. You cannot gain temporary hit points this way again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Hide in Shadows
entries: Disappearing into the shadows is effortless to you.

{@b BENEFIT:} When at least lighly obscured or in dim light, you can use a bonus action or reaction to become invisible until the start of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Hospitaler
entries: Your healing skills in and out of the field of battle are exemplary.

{@b BENEFIT:} Each time you use a healer's kit to stabilize a dying creature, or restore hit points to a wounded creature, the target regains an additional number of hit points equal to your character level.  Additionally, as an action, you can spend five uses of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and end one disease or one condition afflicting it.  The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.   Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Ironclad
entries: You know how to use your armor to partially deflect the most powerful of blows.

{@b BENEFIT:} While wearing heavy armor and you are hit by a nonmagical weapon attack, you can use a reaction and gain resistance from that attack's damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Rousing Leader
entries: You can inspire your allies more effectively than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When inspiring your companions, you can choose to give each creature you inspire a d4 Inspiration die.  Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, ar saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds ar fails. Once the Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Inspiration die (including the Bard's) at a time. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Superior Athelete
entries: You are a very accomplished athlete.

{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you make a Dexterity or Strength ability check or saving throw, you can roll a d8 and add it to the result. You can choose to do this after you roll the initial die, but before the outcome is determined.  You can use this feature three times.  You regain all  expended uses after you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Death Touch
entries: You gain more from a creature's death than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} As Touch of Death, except in addition, when you reduce a creature within 5 feet of you to 0 hit points, you regain a number of ki points equal to one-fourth your monk's level, rounded up. You cannot gain ki point this way again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Kiss of Death
entries: Your can channel your energy to kill a weakened creature instantly.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can sense when your strike has nearly dealt a mortal blow to a creature.  When you reduce a creature within 5 feet of you to a number of hit points equal to or less than your monk level (the DM must inform you when this happens), you can spend 2 ki points to deal necrotic damage equal to the creature's remaining current hit points. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Aura of Guardian
entries: Your Aura of the Guardian is more potent than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} Whenever you shield an ally from harm through your Aura of the Guardian, you can choose to reduce the damage you take to half. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Divine Allegiance
entries: You take less damage when you use your Divine Allegiance.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use your reaction to magically substitute your own health for that of the target creature, you can choose to take only half the damage. You can use this feature for Divine Allegiance three times.  You regain all expended uses once you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Earth's Endurance
entries: You can temporarily change the density of your skin to that of stone.

{@b BENEFIT:}  While standing on solid stone, soil, or metal, you can use a reaction and gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons until the end of the turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Fire's Focus
entries: You have remarkable focus.  You are able to concentrate on an enemy and take advantage of its weaknesses.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, select a creature.  You can use a bonus action and choose one of two benefits: Gain advantage on all of your weapon attacks made against the chosen creature or Impose disadvantage to the chosen creature's saving throws against your attacks and spells until the end of the turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Wind's Dance
entries: You can command the eternal winds around you to give you temporary flight.
{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action and gain a flying speed of 40 feet until the end of the turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Hide of Stone
entries: Your body embraces the rigors of the Underdark and can take on something of its hue and toughness.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can turn your skin to look like and feel as cold and hard as the natural stonework in your surroundings.   On your turn, you can use an action to transform your outer skin into stone that blends well with the surroundings.  You gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.  In addition, you impose disadvantage on creature’s Intelligence and Wisdom checks when trying to detect your presence in subterranean surroundings. This effect lasts while you maintain concentration, up to an hour.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Slay Monster
entries: You can deal a mortal blow to the target of your Slayer's Prey.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, after successfully hitting a target of your Slayer's Prey with your weapon, you can choose to deal an additional 35 (10d6) damage from your weapon.  The target is allowed a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).  On a successful save, the target takes only half the additional damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Bravado
entries: You perform athletic and acrobatic stunts with style.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can can add your Charisma modifier to the result of your Strength or Dexterity ability check or saving throw.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Blessed by the Gods
entries: You can make Favored of the Gods more effective than normal.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Favored of the Gods, you can choose to add your Charisma modifier to the result. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.  You can still use Favored of the Gods normally.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Forked Lightning
entries: You can strike up to three creatures with powerful lightning strokes.

{@b BENEFIT:} As an action on your turn, choose up to three target creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.  Lightning springs forth from your hand and splits,   arching toward your chosen targets.  Each creature must must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC.  On a failure, a target takes 45 (10d8) lightning damage. On a success, a target takes half the damage.  This feature is considered as a spell for Heart of the Storm's purposes.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Sea Form
entries: You can transform into a Water Elemental.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to transform into a Water Elemental.  For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Divine Energy
entries: You can create a nimbus of energy that can heal allies and hurt enemies.

{@b BENEFIT:} While using Otherworldly Wings, you can use an action and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet that you can see equal to your Charisma modifier.  Roll 4d8.  The creatures you chose regain hit points equal to the number you rolled.   All other creatures take damage equal to the number you rolled.  The damage type is radiant if you are good or lawful and necrotic if you are evil or chaotic.  You can choose either if you are neutral.  Creatures are allowed a Charisma saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC.  On a failed save, they take only half the damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Burst of Exalted Glory
entries: You can create a sphere of energy that protects your allies and blinds your enemies.

{@b BENEFIT:} While using Otherworldly Wings, choose a number of creatures within 30 feet that you can see equal to your Charisma modifier as a reaction.  Until the end of start of your next turn, you and the chosen creatures gain resistance to all damage and advantage to all saving throws.  All other creatures within 30 feet must make a Charisma saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC.  On a failed save, they are blinded until the end of your next turn.  Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Stone Form
entries: You can transform into an Earth Elemental.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to transform into an Earth Elemental.  For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Stone's Protection
entries: You can temporarily harden the density of your stone armor.

{@b BENEFIT:} While using Stone's Durability to gain a bonus to your AC while not wearing armor and you are hit by an attack that deals bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, you can use a reaction and gain resistance to that attack's damage. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Storm Form
entries: You can transform into an Air Elemental.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to transform into an Air Elemental.  For all other details, this feature follows the rules and restrictions provided by the Polymorph spell except that you retain the ability to cast spells while in this form and the effect lasts while you concentrate, up to a number of turns equal to your Charisma modifier. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Water Jet
entries: You can blast creatures with powerful sea water.

{@b BENEFIT:} As an action on your turn, you can magically shoot water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw.  The DC is equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC.  On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from you and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked prone. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Wraith Form
entries: You can transform yourself into a wraith-like creature.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can spend 10 sorcery points to transform youself into a creature similar to a wraith.  It has identical features described in Shadow Form, except in addition, you gain the following benefits:    • You have a flying speed of 60 feet. • On your turn, you can use an action to make a melee spell attack that deals 21 (4d8 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to your Sorcerer spell save DC or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Intrusion
entries: Using your alien knowledge, you intrude upon the thoughts of a creature, distracting it and making it more vulnerable to your attack.

{@b BENEFIT:} As a bonus action,  select a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you.  It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.  On a failed save, you impose disadvantage on the creature’s attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your turn. This creature must know at least one language or the feature will have no effect.   Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Improved Hexblade's Curse
entries: You can bestow an additional debilitating effect on the target of your Hexblade's Curse.

{@b BENEFIT:} When you use Hexblade's Curse, you can choose to have the target make a Wisdom saving throw. The save DC equals your Warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Undying Resistance
entries: You are resistant to necrotic and poisonous attacks.
{@b BENEFIT:} You gain resistance to necrotic and poison damage. In addition, attacks that reduce your Constitution, Strength, or maximum hit points only do half of its effect.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Unleash the Ravens
entries: You can summon a swarm of ravens.

{@b BENEFIT:} On your turn, you can use an action and summon swarms of fey ravens.   You can summon a number of swarms equal to one third your level, rounded down.  Each swarm has a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.   The summoned swarms are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The swarms lasts while you concentrate, up to an hour. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Penetrating Evocation
entries: Once in a while you can cast an Evocation spell that is difficult to resist.
{@b BENEFIT:} When you cast an Evocation spell, you can impose disadvantage to the saving throws of all its targets. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Swift Conjuration Spell
entries: You can sometimes cast certain conjuration spells without effort.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can use a bonus action to cast a cantrip or a 4th level spell or below from the school of Conjuration. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: USAGE NOTE
entries: Reference {@book This Pc Talents Book|CharacterTalents1} for information on how to implement Talents you game.
(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)

optionalfeature.name: Silencer
entries: You can reduce the sound of your Thunder Monger.

{@b BENEFIT:} You can craft a noise-reducing module that you can mount and screw on your Thunder Cannon's barrel.  It takes an action to do so. Once the silencer is screwed on, the Thunder Cannon's normal range is reduced to 75 feet, and its maximum range is reduced to 250 feet.  However, the noise it makes when fired is reduced to a muffled blast which can only be heard within 30 feet.

(Talents are effectively 1/2 powered feats, intended to be granted more frequently)
